alert.note: Alert for Giles; Marshall; Maury (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:32PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Marshall, southeastern Maury and northern Giles Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 632 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Pulaski, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pulaski, Cornersville, Lynnville and Culleoka. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 16 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
